info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 25 at 2:47AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Beauregard, northwestern Calcasieu Parishes in southwestern Louisiana and Newton Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Newton to near Bon Weir to near Bancroft to near Devils Pocket to Deweyville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Merryville, Singer, Deweyville, De Quincy, Toledo Bend Dam, Call, Starks, Fields, Bon Weir, Burkeville, Trout Creek, Lunita, Bivens, Mayflower, Devils Pocket, Oretta, Stringtown, Buhler and Farrsville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.
